context: Does the usb receiver work with logitech keyboards? E.g., I am looking at a LT K750 and wondering whether either receiver will work for both devices.
response: No, it's a unique receiver that's not compatible with other Logitech products. The K750 uses the Logitech unifying receiver which is compatible with a range of Logitech products that supports unifying, but there are no Logitech gaming mice that support unifying receivers currently. Net, you'll need to use both receivers with that keyboard and mouse combination.

context: Are the Home, End, PageUp, PageDown  functions accessed by using the shift key or NumLock? Also, I see tat the default function of the "2" is up arrow

context: What is the length of the cord?
response: It should be around 6 foot.  It is long enough for me to use it with my laptop connected to my TV, and be sitting a good distance from it.  It is a very good mouse for the price that you pay for it.  The mouse feels very light so it is comfortable for long uses.

context: It's been about 2 years since it was released. Can it now fit the PS Vita Slim comfortably or do you still have to push on it hard?
response: If you have your PS vita without any protector, it fits perfectly. Yoou can have a screen protector but no more than that. At least in my experience

context: Resistance 3???? Does it still come with Resistance 3???
response: If you preordered while it was a bonus, you'll still get it.  But if you preorder now, you won't.  Other retailers will be taking down the offer as well by Sept. 30, the last day Sony will be honoring it.

context: How much Dorito dust will this hold until it is non-functional?
response: You can buy the optional "Jumbo Battery Cover" (roughly the size of a small merkin), and that extended cavity gives you about an extra 3 cubic inches of dust-storage. Can't go full-potato without extra Dorito dust storage bruh.

context: My keyboard keeps pressing random keys once in a while (like once every 1-3 minutes) usually shift or ctrl keys. Is it broken? Is there a known fix?
response: Update drivers by grabbing official driver from manufacture website and also make sure it is plugged into USB 2 port not 3 or 1.1, membrane switches go out by not working at all or giving random presses that dont make sense like pushing the f key and getting a /

context: does it play ps1 games and ps2 games too?
response: all ps3s play ps one games (physical disks). only certain "original fat" ps3 models also play ps2 games.

context: Is blu-ray drive present with the console? if yes, can I play blu ray movies using this?
